data.title: Try their chicken salad!
data.text:
This wonderful restaurant is located near an elementary school in an old school building. The menu has a wonderful selection of soups, sandwiches and salads. Everything is fresh and well-presented. My favorite is the chicken salad and tomato basil soup. The prices are reasonable. 
Highly recommended.

data.title: Check your watch!
data.text: Very limited hours - 11 until 2 Monday through Friday - but good food. I had the Tuscan Turkey sandwich with Tomato Basil soup and would recommend both. Small but charming venue in a very old building.

data.title: Small Out of the Way Restaurant in Moore, Oklahoma
data.text: Two Olives Cafe is a small restaurant located in the old high school building in down town Moore.  The old high school has been turned into small business offices and is quite charming.  Two Olives is more of a luncheon place to go to have a quiet and peaceful atmosphere. The food is average, the wait time is reasonably quick and you never know who you may see.  I know this restaurant well since my son's business, Trifecta Communications has offices right across the hall from it.  Try it for a peaceful, quite and good lunch.  They also cater.

data.title: great atmosphere and awesome food!!!
data.text: love the cozy old italian feel complete with rock walls, as well as the fresh carnation on every table. restaurant itself is in the historical old Moore High School, so it abounds with character anyway. food is to die for. awesome sandwiches - my favorite is the C.M.S. - chicken mushroom swiss, with added baja and horseradish sauce. yummy! one of the sides is a cold pasta salad that many people just love, i prefer chips but i'm not a pasta fan at all. they do make a wonderful pizza as well. owner is very friendly, and always ready to go the extra mile to make the food "just right". highly recommend a visit here. hours are limited, 11-2 mon-fri, 11-3 sat, and closed sunday.

data.title: Great food
data.text: I love the old school house where Two Olives is located.  My grandpa and dad went to school in this building and I went to school right next door so maybe that's why it has such a good feeling to me, but I love it.  I have been for special lunches with a bunch of girls, just my daughter and I, a baby shower, wedding shower  and every time I go it's just like a family gathing.  We love the food and the friendly people who work there

data.title: Unique
data.text: In a city where we have tons of chain restaurants for sandwiches it's great to find this little gem. On our last visit I had the italian club and my wife had the chicken salad. Prepared perfect and a great place for lunch. Love it!

data.title: Definitely will come back
data.text: First time to eat at this place. I will be coming back - my husband had the italian club sandwich with pasta salad. I had the Mediterranean chicken sandwich and tomato basil soup. We both liked everything we had. The service was excellent and very friendly. I don't know if it was the owner or employee that waited on us but she was very friendly/explained everything to us.

data.title: Return visit just as good
data.text: The chicken salad was so fresh and tasty and the balsamic pasta salad is a unique and special flavor. My partner had the caesar salad. The dressing has a spicy finish that is very good. I don't usually like flavored tea but their raspberry tea was very refreshing without the sweetness. Will visit again!

data.title: Really Unique Atmosphere
data.text: Two Olives is a quaint cafe style restaurant with great sandwiches, soup or salad. Everything is made fresh right on the spot and the Tomato Soup is so good that it makes you feel better when you are sick! The only thing I dislike about the place is that it's not open later!

data.title: Super service and great food
data.text: This was a great experience.  Arrived late and the staff was gracious and made us two chicken salad sandwiches and pasta to go.  The sandwiches were superb.  Pasta salad was outstanding.   We will go back the next time we are in Moore.

data.title: Cafe yummy
data.text: Great food, great service and great price. I tried a turkey sand which with the pasta salad and it was very good. I also got a brownie for my husband that he enjoyed.

data.title: New items
data.text: coffee is NEVER made. short staff. Some of the food has way too much garlic.. It would be great to have  tuna or egg salad sand. or salad on bed lettuce with chips or fruit.

data.title: You just won’t find a better sandwich!
data.text:
They are always packed and busy, but the staff has always been so considerate and nice. Even though you can tell they are sometimes overwhelmed by the amount of customers. The service is always prompt. I wish they were open more than just lunchtime Mon-Sat. It is a wonderful place to meet a friend or family members for lunch. They also do well with big groups. I had my bridal luncheon there a while back and it was perfect. 

The Chicken Salad Sandwich is the best I have ever had. It has ruined me for all other chicken salad sandwiches, after having something that great, I just can’t eat the mediocre versions anymore.  The Mediterranean Chicken Sandwich is also perfectly done. The bread they use on these sandwiches has the perfect crunch, but also melts in your mouth. The pasta salad that you can get as a side (some crazy people actually choose chips) is so awesome! It consists noodle in this delicious, balsamic vinaigrette based sauce with little bits of tomato and black olive mixed in.  So good! To finish off your meal, the lemon bars are the perfect balance of tart, sweet, and savory.

data.title: Very Unprofessional Service! Will definitely not recommend this venue for any event!
data.text: Owner very unprofessional! Did not come through with party details as discussed. Catered food was not as had been previously requested and was not very good either!

data.title: Great spot for lunch!
data.text: I've been here several times and the food is always fresh and delicious.  My favorite is the salad and sandwich deal.  Great variety and they have desserts too.  Nice place to meet friends and you never feel like they are anxious for you to leave, which makes it a great place to meet.

data.title: Great Little Lunch Place with Fresh Ingredients!
data.text: Two Olives is a small little lunch spot in one of the historic school buildings in Moore, OK. They are open from 11a-2p M-F and until 3p on Saturday. Fresh ingredients make all their dishes and sandwiches wonderful. It can get really crowded during the lunch rush - but, you can call in your order for pick up as well. The chicken salad sandwich is great with nuts, grapes, celery and it is served on toasted ciabatta bread. They have soup and lunch specials each day. I can hardly wait to go back and try another sandwich - plus the homemade lemon bars are addictive!
